title: NHL roundup: Canadiens beat Sens, 3-1
text:
NHL roundup: Canadiens beat Sens, 3-1 October 12, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 12, 2015, 1:21 AM FROM NEWS SERVICE REPORTS | Print 
Tomas Plekanec scored twice in the first period and Mike Condon made 19 saves in his NHL debut to help the Montreal Canadiens beat the Senators, 3-1, on Sunday night in Ottawa. 
The 25-year-old Condon allowed only Jean-Gabriel Pageau’ short-handed goal midway through the second period in the Senators’ home opener. Torrey Mitchell added a goal for Montreal in the third period. 
Montreal improved to 3-0-0, while Ottawa dropped to 2-1-0. 
Matt O’Connor made 31 saves for Ottawa in his NHL debut. 
Condon and O’Connor are the first goalies to make their first NHL starts in the same game since Oct. 14, 1967. 
Plekanec opened the scoring at 9:41 of, beating O’Connor with a sharp angle shot. Plekanec added his third the season with 1:26 left, breaking in alone and beat O’Connor through the legs. 
Pageau pulled Ottawa with one in a 2-one-1 break with Curtis Lazar. 
Mitchell redirected P.K. Subban’s shot from just inside the blue line at 5:41 of the third, leaving O’Connor with little chance. 
Senators owner Eugene Melnyk took part in a ceremonial opening faceoff with his two daughters. He had a liver transplant this year. 
COYOTES 2, PENGUINS 1 (at Glendale, Ariz.) — Mike Smith shook off a hard collision to stop 27 shots, Jordan Martinook scored his first career NHL goal and Arizona held off Pittsburgh late Saturday night. 
BRIEFS: Bruins forward Brad Marchand sustained a concussion Saturday against the Canadiens and is out indefinitely. … Sabres goalie Robin Lehner will miss six to 10 weeks with an ankle sprain. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
